subject: RE: [junit] Good examplefor Intro course
msgSnippet: ... ...  but it seems to me they will be even more distracted by having to learn this unfamiliar platform and language. IMO, it should be the instructor who
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Jason Rogers

> One tack I take in doing these types of workshops is to
> concentrate on unit testing skills, not language issues. I
> therefore tend to choose a language platform that is
> unfamiliar to the wider audience. This helps the audience to
> not get caught up in implementation details (eg. coding
> styles, method names, etc.) because if it is a language they
> are unfamiliar with they will tend not to bother about those
> things.

... but it seems to me they will be even more distracted by having to learn
this unfamiliar platform and language.

IMO, it should be the instructor who adjusts their class to what their
students know and not the other way around...

--
CÃ©dric
